WRITING.TITLE: StarBonds
WRITING.TEXT:
After some advice from my last post and poking around old posts here, I invested in 2 StarBonds based on the info on Kaigee. I chose HMIRR and JSTAT, both adjusting on Tuesday and with DROI of 2.16 and 1.22 respectively. Their changes are green so I bought, not shorted.
I invested earlier in the week and if I'm understanding currently, I should have made some money off each daily. Instead, I'm at 0.00 net gain with HMIRR and I've lost $700 with JSTAT.
Did I mess up my understanding of how SBs work?

I think I was viewing warrants incorrectly. I didn't quite know what the value was all about. For example, in my post, I mentioned I bought in at $17.xx. Now I am understanding that it means the movie had already made $17M over the strike price and finished at $19M over. There is no separate payout for "the warrant part" as I put it. The value will just keep gradually increasing until the 12 weeks is up.
I know that's old information and probably really obvious but I'm outting my dumb-dumb moment in case it helps another newbie!
Thank you! I think I figured out the flaw in how I was viewing warrants. It's making more sense now!
Assuming you liked your grandma and enjoyed yourself at the school fetes, thanks! :-)

Oh, I think that was the reason! It just had its warrant IPO not too long ago and I wasn't sure I wanted to tie up the funds for so long.
I'd love to read more of your thoughts if you feel like posting later!
Thank you! I did end up buying into all of the current blockbuster warrants except Boss Baby though I can't remember why I didn't. It's already surpassed the strike price. Hmm...
Great, thank you!
Sure! I used this one: http://joyofbaking.com/shortbreads/shortbreadcookies.html I didn't have any cookie cutters so I just cut my dough into rectangles.

WRITING.TITLE: Help understanding warrants
WRITING.TEXT:
I'm really new to HSX and I was advised to look into blockbuster warrants to make some free money. I bought 10,000 shares of Lego Batman at $17.59 and it just delisted at $19.69. Yay!
But I'm wondering when the warrant part comes into play. I was paid for the system selling my stock for me, but when does the warrant cash out happen? Do they need to wait for official weekend numbers? Box Office Mojo said it made over $300M and with a strike price of $155M, that should mean each share earns $145, right?
Or am I completely misunderstanding warrants?
*Update:* It would have helped if I had read Mojo correctly. The film made $174M, not $300M. If I had realized this earlier, the numbers would have made sense much earlier! 174 - 155 = 19. And the light bulb turns on.
I would not eat that because the bottom layer's colour and texture reminds me of when my cat throws up after eating canned food.

Ohhh, I hadn't heard of stuff like that. Yikes!

WRITING.TITLE: Silicone primers causes CC cream to separate
WRITING.TEXT:
I use IT Cosmetics CC cream and the primers I've tried are Monistat anti-chafing gel and The Ordinary's High-Adherence primer. All of these items are silicone based. Does anyone know why the primers would be causing the CC cream to separate on my chin after about 3 hours? They also cause it to cake/crust in areas I usually don't have any issues. My makeup looks SO much better without primer.
I haven't tried a water based primer because I wanted the silicone to help fill in pores and acne-related texture issues.
ETA: Both primers also make me super shiny. Blotting papers can't keep up!

WRITING.TEXT: Remove

I pour about 3 drops onto a cotton pad and hold it to my lashes for a few seconds (10, maybe?) so that the mascara softens a bit. And then I just wipe from root to end a few times until it's all gone. And I use the other side of the cotton pad with more jojoba oil for the other eye.

It is silicone based. I am currently not using a primer because the one that I had was making me super shiny/oily and also causing the CC cream to separate. I have ordered the high-adherence one from The Ordinary but haven't tried it yet.
I just use jojoba oil.

Pigs in a blanket, crockpot sausages in bbq sauce, pizza dip, pizza pinwheels, etc.
But my ultimate suggestion is you take Club crackers, put a tsp of brown sugar on each one, and then wrap with a half slice of bacon. Bake them on low heat for an hour and they are like crack! You can put parmesan cheese instead of the sugar, but the sugar ones always disappear first when I make these.

How do you guys put on your loose powder? I kind of lightly brush it on. But I've seen some videos where they almost violently swirl it into their skin. And then Wayne Goss says to use a powder puff and dab it on gently. A game called Smart Ass. It's a fun trivia board game. There's a sort of sequel/spin-off game called Dumb Ass but it's not as fun.

I took physics in high school and we had to build a machine that could launch a squash ball a specific distance. It was a 2-day competition and your score would be averaged. You basically had to use your machine to throw the ball across a football field. You'd move the machine to where the ball landed and throw again. And again until your ball finally got to the finish line.
I had already been kicked out of my house and was living on my own with little funds to build anything substantial. Meanwhile, several of my classmates got together with at least one father who was an engineer and built several identical machines for the group.
After the first day of competition (where I did so very poorly), I asked the teacher what grade I would get if I sat out on the second day. He told me I'd get a 51%. I decided to compete on the second day despite being absolutely mortified at how awful it was going (it took me at least 5x as long to complete it). When our grades were posted, I ended up with a 49% ... LOWER than I would have gotten if I just sat out the second day completely!
Have you tried Maybelline Full and Soft? It's been a few years since I've used it but I remember it to be pretty natural looking.
Don't know if you already know, but their brown rice doesn't have cilantro.

The ganache was just 1/2 cup of heavy cream and 1 cup of semi-sweet chocolate chips. Place the chocolate chips in a bowl. Heat the cream in the microwave for 30-60 seconds until hot, and pour over the chocolate chips. Wait a minute and then stir together until smooth and silky.

Interesting! I hadn't heard of using that as a primer before. I'll definitely read more about it. Thanks!
The trick is simply to use a light dusting of loose powder all over after you prime, and then apply your foundation as normal. It helps keep you matte for a lot longer. You can also use a bit of powder to set afterwards too. I usually just do a bit on my t-zone.
Thank you! I'll definitely read about that one. I haven't heard of it before.

WRITING.TITLE: Drugstore pore filling primer
WRITING.TEXT:
I'm looking for a drugstore pore filling primer. It doesn't have to be mattefying as the Wayne Goss powder before foundation trick is working wonders. I just have large pores and also some cracks/lines on my chin that I think are caused by past acne.
I have sensitive, combo, acne-prone skin and I think I read that pore fillers tend to lead to breakouts?
The only "primer" I have used in the past is the Monistat gel which made my t-zone very shiny in just an hour or two. I am much more matte without it.
Hoping someone has a suggestion for me!
Don't You Forget About Me - Breakfast Club

You know, I never even considered that. I get into "must cover EVERYTHING" mode and didn't think to just not put makeup there. That should work! I'm very blind without my glasses so I never take them off and no one should be able to see a discrepancy. Thanks!

Damp sponge/BB. I used to get so frustrated when my makeup would highlight my dry patches and flakes when I used my fingers to apply. The day I finally learned about using a damp applicator made me so freaking happy!

I wear glasses and the spots where the nosepads touch my face get red and irritated when I'm wearing makeup (IT Cosmetics CC cream) but it's fine on a non-makeup day. What can I do or use to help with this?

Definitely use a waterproof mascara. My lashes go limp the second regular mascara touches them. Try jojoba oil for removing waterproof makeup. I have sensitive skin and eyes and the oil works great for me.
I have combo skin and this makes me T-zone super, super shiny in just a couple of hours. I was constantly blotting throughout the day! I was really bummed it didn't work for me.
I love watching the lava ooze!
It was delicious leakage!

Where did you find Mini Eggs in that colour combo? I've only ever seen bags with blue, white, yellow, and pink ones.
Edit: I googled and these are the UK version. Never knew there were regional differences in colour!

I usually buy ELF blotting sheets but someone told me to just buy white tissue paper from the gift wrap section of the dollar store and cut it up. Is it really the same thing? It won't take off my makeup while blotting?
ELF has one for $1 or $2. I don't wear eyeshadow but I have oily lids and it keeps my mascara from smudging.
Thanks! Lol, that makes the nickname even better!

I really like this CC cream but it is more full coverage than it sounds like you are looking for. I do set it with a loose powder because the finish is more dewy than I would like. But I like the staying power and the fact that it doesn't feel like a heavy foundation.
I'm new to this sub... Where did "Amnebet" come from?
How many "Being" specials have there been so far? Barb, Butch, the Edwards, Deb, and now Matt. Were there any others?
You look just like her! I think you did a great job with the makeup and hair.
Audrey from Twin Peaks? :-)

How are you applying your foundation? I used to be a fingers-only applier but after switching to dabbing it on with a damp sponge, my makeup goes on a lot smoother.
Also, I use twice the amount of moisturizer I would normally use before I do my makeup. So on a non-makeup day, I use 1 pump. On makeup days, I use 2 and let it set while I dry my hair.

I use Cerave moisturizing lotion (just the regular formula) and it's pretty lightweight. I have sensitive skin and have not experienced a breakout from it. I like that it dries matte! It doesn't have SPF though but they also have a lotion for AM that has SPF 30. I've never used it though so I can't comment on it.
That does sound terrifying! I'm definitely going to have to watch some videos before I attempt it. Thank you!
Has anyone used Lash Boost from Rodan Fields? It's really pricey but the results pictures have me coveting it.

Darn, I thought I might have that one in my to-be-tried stash but it's the Full Fan Effect one (pink). I use a Shu Uemera curler which I sometimes carefully heat for a few seconds with a hair dryer.
I have been watching videos but I'm kind of overhauling my skincare and foundation/CC cream choices so I tend to get ADD and skip around. I'll definitely have to focus more on mascara videos.

Thank you. I tried Clump Crusher a few months ago and even though I got the water resistant kind, my lashes drooped the second it went on. I wondered if maybe it wasn't quite as waterproof as other mascaras and that's why they had to call it water resistant?

WRITING.TITLE: Looking for a dupe of Maybelline One By One mascara
WRITING.TEXT:
One By One was my HG mascara until it got discontinued a couple of years ago. I've been jumping around to different Maybelline formulas (this brand works the best for my lashes) but have yet to find a mascara + brush combo that even compares.
I'm looking for a dupe, preferably drugstore brand that has a waterproof version. I have the typical Asian lashes: straight, short, points down, hard to curl, sparse, light, blah.
Right now I'm using Maybelline Lash Sensational (original pink tube) which is wet and goopy, despite being a few months old, but I can manage it decently by running an old One By One brush through it. I also use the Rocket one because I like that type of brush but I have to use like 5+ coats to get the coverage I want.
Hoping someone has a suggestion for me!

Honestly, they've gotten away from walkers so much this season that it didn't even occur to me that Sasha would turn while in the casket. I knew she'd take the poison but I thought they'd open the casket up, Rick and co would see her dead and get mad, and there'd be fighting. I think I was as surprised as Negan when she popped out all walkerfied.

I'm pretty sure I saw Enid fighting in the battle.
Related question: when did Judith get to Hilltop? I seem to have spaced out and forgotten.
She's fine (and full, lol)! She was on a chain next to the platform that Ezekiel, Rick, and Maggie were standing on at the end.
Thanks! I figured they were already done since they're all so popular.

These have probably already been done but I would love to take part in novelty socks and Doctor Who (I'm new to the show).

WRITING.TITLE: Puzzle size for an Amazing Race event
WRITING.TEXT: I'm running a scavenger hunt/Amazing Race type of event soon and I want to include activities for the teams to do so it's not just a foot race. How big of a jigsaw puzzle should I get? The teams will be about 4 adults on each. I'm thinking each activity should take about 10-15 minutes. 100 pieces? 200? Thanks!
